section: The business name of the Venture will be BM&V2GO, however the partnership name will be Vaccines2Go.
explanation: This creates a contradiction, because the partnership can't have two names in the same agreement, particularly a 'business name' that is different from a 'partnership name'. This creates ambiguity about which name is the legally recognized name of the joint venture, potentially causing confusion with contracts, branding, and legal filings. The contract doesn't specify which name takes precedence.

section: Each of the Members has contributed to the capital of the Venture, in cash or property in agreed upon value, as follows (the "Capital Contribution"): Member Contribution Description Agreed Value BorrowMoney.com, inc 1, 500 square feet of Leased/rent office Space Includingspecified Description of duty* $3,500.00 USD JVLS, LLC dba Vaccines 2Go $60,000.00 USD From Monthly Government , City And State, And Or Private Awarded Contracts. Plus (10%) Of Any Generated Gross Revenue, In Add i t i on to The To ta l Contributions. $3,500,000.00 USD
explanation: This section displays a significant disparity in valuation. While BorrowMoney.com, inc. is contributing physical space valued at $3,500, JVLS, LLC dba Vaccines 2Go, contributes $60,000 from monthly contracts plus 10% of gross revenue, but is valued at $3,500,000. This suggests a gross miscalculation of the JVLS, LLC dba Vaccines 2Go, contribution. It is contradictory to provide the capital of the contribution from monthly awarded contracts but evaluate the contribution at a higher amount. The valuation of JVLS, LLC dba Vaccines 2Go, is unreasonable and is an inconsistency within this agreement.

section: Any management vote required will be determined such that each Manager receives one vote carrying equal weight, unless otherwise decided by BorrowMoney.com inc.
explanation: This creates a structural flaw in the agreement by allowing BorrowMoney.com inc. to unilaterally change the voting power of the managers. The initial statement implies an equal weighting of votes. Then it contradicts this by stating that BorrowMoney.com inc. can change the voting structure. There is an unclear explanation of the circumstances in which BorrowMoney.com inc. can make such a decision, or what the new voting structure would look like, leading to uncertainty and potential abuse.
